intro: Wikstroemia sikokiana, commonly known as the Kii Island flower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Japanese island of Kii. It belongs to the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a leathery texture with a distinctive aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
